embeds.title: Liquidate
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Unplayable** if you have negative **Strength** :p_strength:.
Lose 2 **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 2 (3) **Potency** :p_potency:.

messages.content: good for slime focused decks
you would generally take more splits if you take this care to generate the strength to fuel it
though the renewable split is also good
reverse Reprogram lol
except unlike the actual reverse reprogram, this isn't OP
still pretty damn good if you're using slimes a lot
win con card, sorta needs to show up somewhat early though or else you would of already found yourself specing into a deck thats not relying heavily on slimes.
The boss cards and relics that give strength are notably helpful for this card
Tbh it kinda feels like a trap, it's a bit on the slow side. Works best with block slimes.
Glad my favorite pick got chosen
I love this card as just using it once makes this card help out slimes a ton  but you can also just see this as an overexert that doesn't absorb your slimes
Pairs well with all the absorb cards slimeboss has
Works alot better early on if you have a relic that splits into a slime

Potency can be a reasonable form of scaling, though you do have to commit to it, and you will really want to have leeching slimes to pair with it. Liquidate is one of those cards that requires a fairly specific setup to be good, and you often won't have the right setup when you find this at a boss reward/shop. It definitely got a nice buff with the change to the basic card split, and also pairs well with the new reformation to more quickly stack up potency. You will want to take extra slime generating cards, or other sources of strength so that you can keep playing this on the 2nd/3rd cycle through the deck.

Really good with jeremiah's banner to get an extra slime slot and multiply the value of potency. Watch out for negative synergy with grow. Upgrade is pretty important, you will want to prioritize it.
The only other slimes I could see being reasonable for it is mire slime cause <leeching strike> and ancient slime cause that's just free card draw

embeds.title: Leeching Strike
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage.
**Consume** - Gain **Block** :p_block: equal to the enemy's **Goop** :p_goop:.

messages.content: if you're reliant on slimes, you may be trying to take advantage of a low-energy strategy
so a 0-cost potency card works very well with that
These were all changed to not, there are no longer any relics that do so
<? type=relic split>

embeds.title: Greed Ooze
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, spawn Greed Ooze.
At Rest Sites, Greed Ooze will take 50 of your souls :p_gold:, increasing its damage by 1.
When Greed Ooze is absorbed gain Revive Greed.
Revive Greed (2 (1) :energy_slime: ): **Retain**. Split into Greed Ooze. **Exhaust**.
*A friend found in the Spire who devours souls.*

messages.content: oh
wait am I stupid?
slimed tail did get changed to not split
<slimed tail>

embeds.title: Slimed Tail
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Whenever you Split, gain 3 **Block** :p_block:.
*A fake tail to trick enemies during combat, completely covered in slime.*

messages.content: used to be split into uh i think aoe slime at 50% or less hp or something
so at 50% summon aoe slime and play that one power
I feel like slimed tails effect would be much more effective as a rare power
As this would just help split decks solve the whole block problem
<tough bandages> says hello

embeds.title: Tough Bandages
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Whenever you discard a card during your turn, gain 3 **Block** :p_block:.
*Loss gives strength.*

messages.content: [[loss]]

embeds.title: Buffer
embeds.description:
Keyword / Corrupt the Spire

Prevent the next HP loss.

messages.content: The flavor text is a lie
ehh split decks mostly solve block via leeching with high potency and <serve and protect> in my experience

embeds.title: Serve & Protect
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 10 (15) **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Blur** :p_blur: for each Slime.
**Absorb** all Slimes.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: does require a bit of thought to work with though
and leeching is inherently inconsistent since there is no way to repeatedly summon a certain slime, just a random slime.
you mostly don't want to spam split without thinking
if it's consistency you want
so after you've exhausted majority of split cards you stop splitting with leeching on top
then commands+potency solve block for you
Well the basic split card change disincentives said play styles
<split leeching>

embeds.title: Split: Leeching
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Split** into a **Leeching Slime.**
**Command** 2 (3) times.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: the common slime cards are a pretty reliable way to set up strategies around certain slimes.

most often i've used split leeching with potency stack as a copy of defects focus + frost orbs. Also split mire giving you a mire slime guaranteed can be useful for decks that have synergy from goop even without potency. Split Bruiser does 10 damage for 1 cost and more throughout the fight; despite being a skill its great in act one.

doing this means making glop chop and split weaker cards; but that doesn't matter if your winning the boss fight by getting a good combination of slimes in play every time and for hallway fights you can play your cards that give you random slimes freely. Simply drafting like 3 leeching splits also works; it lets you burn one safely and still have 2 extras to fall back on
